questions.question: An object's interaction with a force is represented by a trapezoidal force-time graph. The force increases from 0 to 600 N in 0.1 s, stays at 600 N for 0.2 s, and drops to 0 in 0.1 s. Calculate the change in velocity for a 5.0 kg mass subjected to this force.
questions.explanation: Impulse = area under graph = 180 N·s. $\Delta v = 180/5 = 36$ m/s.

questions.question: A 65 kg gymnast lands from a jump at 5.0 m/s. Calculate the average force if they land stiff-legged and stop in 0.04 s.
A 65 kg gymnast lands from a jump at 5.0 m/s. Calculate the average force if they bend their knees and stop in 0.50 s.

A 0.20 kg puck slides on a frictionless surface at 20.0 m/s at an angle of 0° (along the x-axis). It is struck by a stick, providing an impulse of 5.0 N·s at an angle of 90° (along the y-axis). Find the magnitude of the final velocity.

A 10 kg crate is pulled with a horizontal force of 80 N for 4.0 seconds. If the coefficient of kinetic friction is 0.30, calculate the total change in the crate's momentum. (Use $g = 10 \text{ m/s}^2$)

A 2.5 kg cart moving at 4.0 m/s to the right collides with a stationary 1.5 kg cart. After the collision, the 2.5 kg cart continues to move to the right but at a reduced speed of 1.0 m/s. Calculate the final velocity of the 1.5 kg cart.

A 0.50 kg ball traveling at 12.0 m/s East collides head-on with a 0.80 kg ball traveling West at 5.0 m/s. After the impact, the 0.50 kg ball rebounds West at 4.0 m/s. Determine the final velocity of the 0.80 kg ball.
A 5.5 kg rifle fires a 12.0 g bullet. If the bullet exits the muzzle with a velocity of 750 m/s, calculate the recoil velocity of the rifle.

Two ice skaters, initially at rest, push off from each other. Skater A has a mass of 55 kg and Skater B has a mass of 80 kg. If Skater A moves away at 3.2 m/s, what is the resulting velocity of Skater B?

A 1,200 kg car traveling at 25.0 m/s rear-ends a 3,500 kg truck that is moving in the same direction at 15.0 m/s. If the two vehicles lock bumpers and move together after the impact, what is their final common velocity?

scoreMessages.90: Excellent! You've mastered conservation of momentum problems.
scoreMessages.70: Good work! Review 2D impulse and inelastic collisions.
scoreMessages.50: Keep practicing. Focus on $p_i = p_f$ in various scenarios.
scoreMessages.0: Let's review. Study momentum conservation in collisions and recoil.
